## 2. RMP method - Corrected Mixture of Distributions
### 2.1 Incompatible situation with two parameters

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(nimble)

# Step 1: Define mixture normal distribution
dmixnorm <- nimbleFunction(
  run = function(x = double(0), mu1 = double(0), mu2 = double(0),
                 sd1 = double(0), sd2 = double(0), w = double(0),
                 log = integer(0, default = 0)) {
    returnType(double(0))
    logProb <- log(w * dnorm(x, mu1, sd1) + (1 - w) * dnorm(x, mu2, sd2))
    if(log) return(logProb)
    else return(exp(logProb))
  }
)

rmixnorm <- nimbleFunction(
  run = function(n = integer(0), mu1 = double(0), mu2 = double(0),
                 sd1 = double(0), sd2 = double(0), w = double(0)) {
    returnType(double(0))
    if(runif(1) < w)
      return(rnorm(1, mu1, sd1))
    else
      return(rnorm(1, mu2, sd2))
  }
)

# Register mixture normal distribution
registerDistributions(list(
  dmixnorm = list(
    BUGSdist = "dmixnorm(mu1, mu2, sd1, sd2, w)",
    Rdist = "dmixnorm(mu1, mu2, sd1, sd2, w)"
  )
))

# Step 2: Modified RMP code - true mixture of distributions
code_RMP <- nimbleCode({
  # Historical parameter priors
  beta0_h ~ dnorm(0, sd=1000)
  beta1_h ~ dnorm(0, sd=1000)
  
  # Mixture prior parameters
  tau01 ~ dunif(0, 1000)  # beta0 historical information uncertainty
  tau02 ~ dunif(0, 1000)  # beta0 vague prior uncertainty
  tau11 ~ dunif(0, 1000)  # beta1 historical information uncertainty  
  tau12 ~ dunif(0, 1000)  # beta1 vague prior uncertainty
  
  # RMP core: using dmixnorm to implement true mixture distribution
  # Each parameter has 50% probability from historical information, 50% probability from vague prior
  beta0_c ~ dmixnorm(mu1 = beta0_h, mu2 = 0, 
                     sd1 = tau01, sd2 = tau02, w = 0.5)
  beta1_c ~ dmixnorm(mu1 = beta1_h, mu2 = 0, 
                     sd1 = tau11, sd2 = tau12, w = 0.5)
  
  # Error terms
  sigma1 ~ dunif(0, 1000)
  sigma2 ~ dunif(0, 1000)
  
  # Historical data likelihood
  for (i in 1:n){
    y_h[i] ~ dnorm(beta0_h + beta1_h * x[i], sd = sigma1)
  }
  
  # Current data likelihood
  for (i in 1:n){
    y_c[i] ~ dnorm(beta0_c + beta1_c * x[i], sd = sigma2)
  }
})
```

```{r}
set.seed(123)
# True values of parameters, change the beta0_h and beta1_h separately
beta0_h <- 5
beta1_h <- 5  
beta0_c <- 1    # True value for beta0_c
beta1_c <- 1    # True value for beta1_c
n <- 200 
n_sim <- 100  

# Record the results of simulation
results_RMP_incom <- data.frame(
  beta0c_Estimate = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta0c_Lower_CI = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta0c_Upper_CI = numeric(n_sim),
  beta1c_Estimate = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta1c_Lower_CI = numeric(n_sim), 
  beta1c_Upper_CI = numeric(n_sim)
)

# Initialize vectors to store each MCMC variance
beta0c_variances <- numeric(n_sim)
beta1c_variances <- numeric(n_sim)

# Do 100 replicates of simulation
for (i in 1:n_sim) {
  # Generate data
  x <- runif(n,-1,1)
  e1 <- rnorm(n, mean=0, sd=0.5)  # error term
  e2 <- rnorm(n, mean=0, sd=0.5)
  y_h <- beta0_h + beta1_h * x + e1  # Historical data with beta1_h = 5
  y_c <- beta0_c + beta1_c * x + e2   # Current data with beta1_c = 1
  
  # Input data
  data_nimble <- list(
    y_h = y_h,
    y_c = y_c
  )
  constants_nimble <- list(
    n = length(x),
    x = x
  )
  
  # Set initial values - no intermediate variables needed after modification
  inits_nimble <- list(
    beta0_h=0.5, 
    beta1_h=1.0, 
    beta0_c=0.5, 
    beta1_c=0.5, 
    sigma1=1, 
    sigma2=1,
    tau01=10, 
    tau02=100, 
    tau11=10, 
    tau12=100
  )
  
  # Build NIMBLE model
  nimble_model <- nimbleModel(
    code = code_RMP,
    data = data_nimble,
    constants = constants_nimble,
    inits = inits_nimble
  )
  
  # Compile model
  compiled_model <- compileNimble(nimble_model)
  
  # MCMC sampling
  mcmc_conf <- configureMCMC(nimble_model)
  mcmc_conf$addMonitors(c("beta0_h", "beta1_h", "beta0_c", "beta1_c", 
                          "sigma1", "sigma2"))  # Monitor parameters
  compiled_mcmc <- buildMCMC(mcmc_conf)
  compiled_mcmc <- compileNimble(compiled_mcmc, project = nimble_model)
  
  # Run MCMC
  samples <- runMCMC(compiled_mcmc, niter = 1000, nburnin = 500)
  
  # Extract estimates and CI
  samples_df <- as.data.frame(samples)
  
  # Beta0_c estimates
  beta0c_hat <- mean(samples_df$beta0_c)
  beta0c_lower_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta0_c, 0.025)
  beta0c_upper_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta0_c, 0.975)
  
  # Beta1_c estimates
  beta1c_hat <- mean(samples_df$beta1_c)
  beta1c_lower_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta1_c, 0.025)
  beta1c_upper_CI <- quantile(samples_df$beta1_c, 0.975)
  
  # Calculate variance for each MCMC run
  beta0c_mcmc_var <- var(samples_df$beta0_c)
  beta1c_mcmc_var <- var(samples_df$beta1_c)
  
  # Save the estimates and CI results
  results_RMP_incom[i, ] <- c(beta0c_hat, beta0c_lower_CI, beta0c_upper_CI, 
                             beta1c_hat, beta1c_lower_CI, beta1c_upper_CI)
  
  # Save the variances separately
  beta0c_variances[i] <- beta0c_mcmc_var
  beta1c_variances[i] <- beta1c_mcmc_var
  
  # Print progress
  cat("Completed", i, "simulations\n")
}
```

```{r}
# ========== Complete RMP method statistical metrics calculation ==========

# Basic statistical calculations
# Beta0_c basic metrics
beta0c_bias <- results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c
beta0c_mean_bias <- mean(beta0c_bias)
beta0c_abs_bias <- mean(abs(beta0c_bias))  # absolute bias
beta0c_var_across_sims <- var(results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Estimate)  # variance across simulations
beta0c_mean_mcmc_var <- mean(beta0c_variances)  # average MCMC variance
beta0c_mse <- mean((results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c)^2)
beta0c_rmse <- sqrt(beta0c_mse)
beta0c_coverage <- mean(results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Lower_CI <= beta0_c & 
                        results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Upper_CI >= beta0_c)

# Beta1_c basic metrics
beta1c_bias <- results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c
beta1c_mean_bias <- mean(beta1c_bias)
beta1c_abs_bias <- mean(abs(beta1c_bias))  # absolute bias
beta1c_var_across_sims <- var(results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Estimate)  # variance across simulations
beta1c_mean_mcmc_var <- mean(beta1c_variances)  # average MCMC variance
beta1c_mse <- mean((results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c)^2)
beta1c_rmse <- sqrt(beta1c_mse)
beta1c_coverage <- mean(results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Lower_CI <= beta1_c & 
                        results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Upper_CI >= beta1_c)

# Relative Bias (standardized bias measurement)
beta0c_relative_bias <- mean((results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c) / beta0_c)
beta1c_relative_bias <- mean((results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c) / beta1_c)

# CI Width (precision metric)
beta0c_ci_width <- mean(results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Upper_CI - results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Lower_CI)
beta1c_ci_width <- mean(results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Upper_CI - results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Lower_CI)

# ========== Output all results ==========

cat("=== RMP Method Complete Statistical Results (Mixture of Distributions) ===\n\n")

# Beta0_c complete statistics
cat("=== Beta0_c Estimation Statistics ===\n")
cat("Mean Bias:", beta0c_mean_bias, "\n")
cat("Absolute Bias:", beta0c_abs_bias, "\n")  # absolute bias
cat("Relative Bias:", beta0c_relative_bias, "\n")
cat("Variance (across simulations):", beta0c_var_across_sims, "\n")
cat("Mean MCMC Variance:", beta0c_mean_mcmc_var, "\n")
cat("MSE:", beta0c_mse, "\n")
cat("RMSE:", beta0c_rmse, "\n")
cat("Average CI Width:", beta0c_ci_width, "\n")
cat("95% Coverage Probability:", beta0c_coverage, "\n\n")

# Beta1_c complete statistics
cat("=== Beta1_c Estimation Statistics ===\n")
cat("Mean Bias:", beta1c_mean_bias, "\n")
cat("Absolute Bias:", beta1c_abs_bias, "\n")  # absolute bias
cat("Relative Bias:", beta1c_relative_bias, "\n")
cat("Variance (across simulations):", beta1c_var_across_sims, "\n")
cat("Mean MCMC Variance:", beta1c_mean_mcmc_var, "\n")
cat("MSE:", beta1c_mse, "\n")
cat("RMSE:", beta1c_rmse, "\n")
cat("Average CI Width:", beta1c_ci_width, "\n")
cat("95% Coverage Probability:", beta1c_coverage, "\n\n")

# Summary format for tables
cat("=== Table Summary Format ===\n")
cat("Method: RMP (Mixture of Distributions)\n")
cat("Beta0_c - Absolute Bias:", beta0c_abs_bias, "\n")  # using absolute bias
cat("Beta0_c - Relative Bias:", beta0c_relative_bias, "\n")
cat("Beta0_c - Variance:", beta0c_mean_mcmc_var, "\n")
cat("Beta0_c - RMSE:", beta0c_rmse, "\n")
cat("Beta0_c - CI Width:", beta0c_ci_width, "\n")
cat("Beta0_c - Coverage:", beta0c_coverage, "\n")
cat("Beta1_c - Absolute Bias:", beta1c_abs_bias, "\n")  # using absolute bias
cat("Beta1_c - Relative Bias:", beta1c_relative_bias, "\n")
cat("Beta1_c - Variance:", beta1c_mean_mcmc_var, "\n")
cat("Beta1_c - RMSE:", beta1c_rmse, "\n")
cat("Beta1_c - CI Width:", beta1c_ci_width, "\n")
cat("Beta1_c - Coverage:", beta1c_coverage, "\n")

# Calculate original bias
beta0c_mean_bias <- mean(results_RMP_incom$beta0c_Estimate - beta0_c)
beta1c_mean_bias <- mean(results_RMP_incom$beta1c_Estimate - beta1_c)

# Report absolute values in table
cat("Beta0_c - Absolute Bias:", abs(beta0c_mean_bias), "\n")
cat("Beta1_c - Absolute Bias:", abs(beta1c_mean_bias), "\n")
```
